data.title: Perezdiaz, LLC is among fewer than 100 authorized assessment bodies for CMMC, serving 80,000+ defense contractors.
data.description: A company, approved by The Cyber AB on February 24, 2026, has been granted authorization to conduct official CMMC Level 2 certification assessments as per 32 CFR Part 170 in the DALLAS-FORT WORTH METROPLEX, Texas. Perezdiaz Federal, the assessment arm of Perezdiaz, LLC, made this announcement on February 27, 2026.

data.title: Magic Eden halts Bitcoin & Ethereum support, shifts focus to Solana. No more multi-chain approach.
data.description: Magic Eden has announced the discontinuation of support for Ethereum-compatible and Bitcoin-based assets, signaling a departure from its previous multi-chain strategy for user adoption. This decision will affect a significant number of users who hold these assets on the platform.

data.description: Some analysts are questioning the reported daily dumping of Bitcoin by Jane Street, as spot Bitcoin ETFs have recorded three consecutive days of inflows. Discussions within the DeFi community are now focusing more on tangible revenue opportunities.

data.title: Zscaler beats Q2 expectations with earnings of $1.01/share and revenue of $815.75 million. Raises FY26 sales guidance.
data.description: Zscaler Inc. (NASDAQ: ZS) exceeded expectations in Q2 with earnings of $1.01 per share, surpassing the estimated 90 cents, and quarterly revenue of $815.75 million, above the projected $798.82 million. The company updated its FY26 revenue guidance upwards. CEO Jay Chaudhry stated, "We believe Zscaler is the cybersecurity platform for the AI age." The innovative Zero Trust platform is designed to secure the rapid growth and scale of AI and agentic workflows. For more details, the full article can be accessed online.

data.title: InventHelp 123Invent client from Morenci, Mich. develops new hour logging & license scanning system called A B C (ALL - BOUT - COMPLIANCE).
data.description: In Pittsburgh on February 27, 2026, an inventor from Morenci, Michigan shared their motivation for creating a new logging and scanning system for hours and licenses by stating, "As a truck driver, I wanted to ensure compliance." The invention, known as A B C (ALL - BOUT - COMPLIANCE), offers a solution to monitor and maintain adherence to regulations in the industry. This innovative design provides an alternative approach to tracking and managing important data, contributing to safer and more efficient operations.

data.title: Former Biden advisor Jared Bernstein criticizes crypto, noting 'almost zero legal use cases' and calling it 'pretty good for scammers'. Bitcoin's 40% decline despite Trump's support emphasized. Regulatory concerns highlighted, with Bernstein questioning asset's value proposition. Crypto industry's influence on Congress and president noted. Regulatory shift seen as impacting prices negatively.
data.description: Jared Bernstein, former Chair of the Biden Council of Economic Advisors, criticized cryptocurrency, referring to it as an asset with minimal legal applications and a magnet for scammers. He highlighted a 40% decline in Bitcoin's value and dismissed the notion that even Donald Trump's support could salvage its situation. Bernstein argued that the industry's claim of being in its early stages no longer justifies its extreme price fluctuations, noting that regulatory challenges had initially masked its true worth until the Trump administration embraced it. According to Bernstein, the backing of Congress and the president did little to enhance crypto's reputation and actually exacerbated its negative perception in the market, leading to a swift depreciation in value. For the full article, visit Benzinga.com.

data.description: An event in Miami on March 13 will introduce an innovative wellness infrastructure that employs artificial intelligence to guide human athletes at three PADL locations in Virginia Key, Florida. The event, organized by Betterness, is set to reveal the culmination of a year-long stealth development effort.

data.title: Proper acquires 6 multifamily operators, now in 15 states with 20,000 units. Consolidating property managers for growth.
data.description: Proper has extended its operations into 15 states, now overseeing close to 20,000 units. The company aims to provide property management owners with opportunities for liquidity and expansion. This expansion was revealed in a press release issued on February 27, 2026, in Chicago. Proper, which functions as a national acquisitions and property management platform with the goal of consolidating property managers, is focused on facilitating growth within the industry.

data.title: Bobby Garnett, a pioneer in vintage retail, revolutionized men's fashion sales with his store.
data.description: The boutique, known as Bobby From Boston, revolutionized the vintage men’s fashion industry by introducing a new approach to retail. This store became a benchmark for many retailers and set a standard for selling vintage men’s wear.

data.title: Bank stocks tumbled as AI concerns rise, with Nasdaq down 0.6%, S&P 500 0.7%, Dow Jones 1.3%, and Russell 2000 2.1%. Financials like Goldman Sachs, Wells Fargo, Bank of America, Morgan Stanley, and Citigroup plunged 5-7%. Diversified financials like Jefferies Financial and Western Alliance Bancorp sank 11%. Private equity firms like Blackstone and Blue Owl Capital dropped 4.58-6.06% on Wall Street.
data.description: Wall Street experienced a significant banking selloff amid concerns over AI-driven economic disruption. By 1:00 p.m. in New York, major indices were down: Nasdaq 100 by 0.6%, S&P 500 by 0.7%, Dow Jones by 1.3%, and Russell 2000 by 2.1%. Leading the decline were financials like GS, WFC, BAC, MS, and C, dropping by 5% to 7%, their worst performance since early April. Diversified financials also suffered, with JEF and WAL plummeting by 11%. Private equity firms were not spared, as BX fell by 4.58%, OWL by 6.06%, and others also trading lower due to impairment fears. More details can be found on Benzinga.com.

data.title: BTC, ETH, XRP, BNB, SOL, DOGE, BCH, ADA, HYPE, LINK price forecast for 2/27: Bitcoin aims for $70k, altcoins maintain gains.
data.description: The rise in Bitcoin's value to over $70,000 faced resistance over the week, resulting in a stall. However, analysts remain optimistic, predicting a limited short-term decline. The question now is whether alternative cryptocurrencies, known as altcoins, will maintain their gains from the week.

data.title: Stock futures drop on Friday, after Jan wholesale inflation data release. 0.5% PPI increase, 0.3% goods prices decline, 0.8% services jump noted. Treasury bond yields at 4.00% and 3.42%. Fed unlikely to change rates in March. Index performance: Dow Jones -0.86%, S&P 500 -0.89%, Nasdaq 100 -0.72%, Russell 2000 -1.19%. Netflix up 8.66% premarket. Read more on Benzinga.com.
data.description: U.S. stock futures dropped after a mixed Thursday close, with major benchmark indices seeing negative trends. The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported a 0.5% increase in the Producer Price Index for final demand in January, driven by a 0.8% jump in services offsetting a 0.3% decline in goods prices. The 10-year Treasury bond yielded 4.00%, and the two-year bond stood at 3.42%. Markets projected a 96.1% chance of the Federal Reserve maintaining current interest rates in March. Index performance showed a decline: Dow Jones -0.86%, S&P 500 -0.89%, Nasdaq 100 -0.72%, Russell 2000 -1.19%. ETFs tracking S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 also decreased: SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (NYSE: SPY) by 0.75% to $684.15, and Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (NASDAQ: QQQ) dipped 0.78% to $604.50. Netflix saw an 8.66% increase in premarket trading after withdrawing from a bidding war. Warner Bros Discovery Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) and Paramount Skydance Corp. (NASDAQ: PSKY) also saw rises.

data.title: ZScaler stock drops after Q2 earnings report, raised revenue outlook corrected. Quarterly earnings of $1.01 per share.
data.description: **Update**: Zscaler Inc. (NASDAQ: ZS) saw a decline in shares during extended trading on Thursday following the release of its second-quarter earnings report, where the company adjusted its fiscal 2026 revenue guidance. The company reported quarterly earnings of $1.01 per share, surpassing the analyst consensus of 90 cents. Investors are advised to monitor the stock movement closely in light of this development. For more information, refer to the complete article on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Dow drops on surprise inflation data, CoreWeave & Rocket Lab plunge. Inflation data impacting market.
data.description: Today, the Dow Jones index saw a significant decline due to unexpected inflation figures. CoreWeave, a partner of Nvidia, experienced a sharp drop in earnings, leading to a plunge in their stock value. This news comes amidst a volatile day in the stock market, with investors closely monitoring these developments. The sudden inflation data has caused concerns among traders, reflecting in the downward movement of key indices. Additionally, Rocket Lab also experienced a notable decrease in its stock value. Stay updated on the latest market trends with live coverage as the situation continues to unfold.
